title: Highline Public School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of any emails sent to or received by the email address/email box “publicrecordsrequest@highlineschools.org” for the time period 1-1-2023 to 01-08-2025.

communications.communication:
01-08-2025

Highline Public School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of any emails sent to or received by the email address/email box “publicrecordsrequest@highlineschools.org” for the time period 1-1-2023 to 01-08-2025.

Via email to: publicrecordsrequest@highlineschools.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. I Request for a complete electronic copy of any emails sent to or received by the email address/email box “publicrecordsrequest@highlineschools.org” for the time period 1-1-2023 to 01-08-2025. Please include any “read” receipts, “forward” or “cc” of these emails and any/all other records regarding or referencing the email address “publicrecordsrequest@highlineschools.org."

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

*** FORWARD THIS PUBLIC  RECORDS REQUEST TO PUBLIC RECORDS OFFICER ***

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of
Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: 1122 Program Purchases

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: 1122 Program Purchases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-An itemized list of all purchases of equipment by Little Rock Police Department through the 1122 program (10 U.S. Code § 281) from 1994 to 2024. This can be provided by collated receipts for purchases. 

-All 1122C: Usage Reports and purchase orders submitted by Little Rock Police Department to the 1122 Program state point of contact (SPOC). According to the 1122 Program Guide, 1122C: Usage Reports and purchase orders are required to be sent to the SPOC within 30 days of purchase.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Lillian Mauldin.

title: FOIA Request: OPW 54338 Omaha Streetcar Vehicle Procurement

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request access to the following records related to the most recent streetcar procurement by the Omaha Streetcar Authority:
Complete Submissions from Competitors: This includes all proposals, bids, and submissions from competing firms, detailing pricing, technical specifications, project timelines, and any other relevant information provided during the procurement process.
Evaluation Documents: Any documents related to the evaluation of the submissions, including scoring sheets, evaluation criteria, and notes from evaluators.
Communications: All communications between the Omaha Streetcar Authority and the competing firms, including emails, letters, meeting minutes, and any other forms of correspondence.
Contracts and Agreements: Copies of any contracts, agreements, or memorandums of understanding signed with the selected firm.
Meeting Minutes and Reports: Minutes from meetings where the procurement was discussed, as well as any reports or presentations related to the procurement process.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Margaret Wardell

title: Jean Louis Marie Le Pen (20 June 1928 – 7 January 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jean Louis Marie Le Pen (20 June 1928 – 7 January 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into French politician Jean Louis Marie Le Pen (20 June 1928 – 7 January 2025), also known by the name Jean-Marie Le Pen. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find a New York Times report on his death at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/01/07/world/europe/jean-marie-le-pen-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Plans, schedules, communications, contracts, and other documents related to the Fiber Optic Resiliency project work on the Lowell commuter rail line, including overarching documents about the project as a whole that affects construction on the Lowell line.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jim Kang

title: FY2024 prisoner operations details

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FY2024 prisoner operations details
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1) any record(s) detailing the average daily population of all individuals remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service in FY 2024 (or most recent fiscal year for which records are available), disaggregated or broken down by:
(a) sex; 
(b) most serious offense or charge (if that is not possible, then by offense category, i.e. violent, property, drugs, other new offense, weapons, immigration, supervision, material witness, etc.); 
(c) case status (i.e., convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced); 
(d) both sex and most serious offense (or if that is not possible, then by offense category) – i.e., the number of females in custody for each offense type and the number of males in custody for each offense type;
(e) both sex and case status (convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced) – i.e. the number of females in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced and the number of males in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced; and
(f) type of facility (i.e., state correctional facility, local correctional facility, privately owned or operated facilities, Federal Bureau of Prisons facilities, hospitals, or other).

If records are unavailable for the average daily population, records reporting the same information for any single day after January 1, 2024 (or the most recent day for which records are available) would be acceptable. Similarly, I would prefer records that contain this information reported as counts (totals), but if such records are unavailable, records reporting the same information by percent (percent of total) would be acceptable. I would also prefer the information be sent via email in PDF format, but would accept other electronic formats. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

I agree to pay any reasonable copying and postage fees of not more than $25. If the cost would be greater than this amount, please notify me. Please provide a receipt indicating the charges for each document. 

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Colorado Open Records Act Request: El Paso County Jury Information
communications.communication:
Good morning, Ms. Jenny Wadhwa.

I am writing in response to the records request you submitted below to the Fourth Judicial District (Jefferson County). The Colorado Judicial Department is not subject to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) that you referenced. Instead, access to the Department’s administrative records is governed by Colorado Supreme Court Rules, Chapter 38, Rule 2 (P.A.I.R.R. 2). You can view the rule and the P.A.I.R.R. 2 policy here<https://www.coloradojudicial.gov/access-guide-public-records-0>. Before, I respond to your records request, I would like to clarify the scope of your request.  You are requesting, “All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the composition of the current master jury list.”  Are you requesting the current master list for the 4th Judicial District or the entire state of Colorado?

When considering the scope of your request, please consider that pursuant to P.A.I.R.R. 2 and Chief Justice Directive 06-01, which you can view here<https://www.coloradojudicial.gov/sites/default/files/2023-08/CJD%2006-01%20Signed%20%20effective%20July%201%2C%202022%20WEB.pdfyou>, you will be charged $30.00 per hour after the first hour for any time it takes the Department to research, review, and/or redact records in response to your request. You will also be charged $0.25 per page for any records that are produced, even if produced electronically. We will not waive these fees, and payment will be required prior to production of any records.  After you’ve had an opportunity to review these authorities and consider the information I’ve shared with you, please let me know if you wish to proceed with your request as it is currently written, modify your request, or withdraw your request.


Thank you,

Tell me how I’m doing!<bit.ly/COREUnitFeedback>

Kayla Cooley (she/her)
Court Programs Analyst III
CORE Unit, State Court Administrator’s Office
Links: JRM<https://judcous.sharepoint.com/sites/jrm>, Court Legislation<https://judcous.sharepoint.com/sites/CourtLegislation>
Work: 720-625-5506
[cid:image001.png@01DB61B4.8AA99A20]

Judicial recognizes the need for digital document accessibility. If you experience inaccessible content and require assistance, please contact us by replying to this email.

communications.communication:

title: Lake Washington School District - Building Access Control Systems and logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District - Building Access Control Systems and logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052
communications.communication:
January 06, 2025 

via email to PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

Lake Washington School District - Building Access Control Systems and logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production:

1. An electronic copy of all records and writings regarding the specifications, installation, operation, and purchase of any and all Building Access Control System(s) for the Lake Washington School District Administrative Offices located in the L.E. Scarr Resource Center at 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052.

Responsive records include but are not limited to:

Key card access system(s)
Video surveillance system(s)
Electronic and Written access logs

Please provide electronic copies of all purchase records, instruction manuals, and system specifications of all Building Access Control Systems and devices in use at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center.

Please provide complete records of all electronic key cards and the name and contact information of each person assigned each specific key card.

Please provide electronic copies of all recorded video surveillance from building cameras installed in the L.E. Scarr Resource Center for the time period June 1, 2024 to January 5, 2025.

Please provide electronic copies of all building access logs and any audits of building access for the time period June 1, 2024 to January 5, 2025.

Please provide any and all incident reports or investigations into any unauthorized building access at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center for the time period January 1, 2020 to January 5, 2025.

Please provide the name and contact information of all personnel authorized to access any Building Access Control Systems and devices in use at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2025-806-00035 Acknowledged
communications.communication:
The Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) has acknowledged your FOIL request FOIL-2025-806-00035. (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2025-806-00035) You can expect a response on or about Thursday, April 10, 2025. 
Additional Information: 
Thank you for contacting The New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD). 
You may also find and access agency information on various other information platforms provided by the City, which may allow you to receive certain agency records more quickly than through FOIL.  Here are some commonly requested records that you can access directly: 
 
• Residential Building Information: HPD Online contains residential building information such as complaints, violations, litigation, registration, building charges, tax block/lot for individual buildings. This information is available through HPD Online portal at https://hpdonline.nyc.gov/hpdonline/. (https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhpdonline.nyc.gov%2Fhpdonline%2F&data=05%7C02%7Chpdfoil%40hpd.nyc.gov%7C5e550478b0364aaa736e08dd2f30f2c0%7C32f56fc75f814e22a95b15da66513bef%7C0%7C0%7C638718609455802803%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UAsYI82cOGKPPCQHHXxU6X5szLyCwEib7VC09P1vbCg%3D&reserved=0) 
 
• Property Records: The Department of Finance (DOF) Automated City Register Information System (ACRIS) contains document images, property records (including certain regulatory agreements) and other property information for Manhattan, Queens, Bronx, and Brooklyn from 1966 to the present https://acrisweb.csc.nycnet/cp/. (https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Facrisweb.csc.nycnet%2Fcp%2F&data=05%7C02%7Chpdfoil%40hpd.nyc.gov%7C5e550478b0364aaa736e08dd2f30f2c0%7C32f56fc75f814e22a95b15da66513bef%7C0%7C0%7C638718609455816899%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UBeqS65iuJRP1ryy75ZnnVd32mrkWI%2FS5dH5WXjs0vM%3D&reserved=0) 
 
• Open Data: HPD collects various information and data while doing business, including complaints and violations, which is available through NYC’s Data portal at https://opendata.cityofnewyork.us/. (https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopendata.cityofnewyork.us%2F&data=05%7C02%7Chpdfoil%40hpd.nyc.gov%7C5e550478b0364aaa736e08dd2f30f2c0%7C32f56fc75f814e22a95b15da66513bef%7C0%7C0%7C638718609455829236%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=bUhv7NEadU57zcwfQ3TXlkSo15qr%2BW3r7Rw4xOra2SM%3D&reserved=0) 
 
• Property Tax Information: The Department of Finance (DOF) Property Tax Public Access web portal contains property information at https://www.nyc.gov/site/finance/property/property.page. (https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nyc.gov%2Fsite%2Ffinance%2Fproperty%2Fproperty.page&data=05%7C02%7Chpdfoil%40hpd.nyc.gov%7C5e550478b0364aaa736e08dd2f30f2c0%7C32f56fc75f814e22a95b15da66513bef%7C0%7C0%7C638718609455841559%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=4Q7OJ%2Fwc4ly%2F6VCSyFmnjfaYFRrqc03u7pt5%2BsuPKSI%3D&reserved=0) 
 
If you have obtained this information independently, please inform us at hpdfoil@hpd.nyc.gov. This will enable us to appropriately close your FOIL request. (mailto:hpdfoil@hpd.nyc.gov) 
 
Thank you, 
HPD FOIL 

Please visit FOIL-2025-806-00035 to view additional information and take any necessary action. (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2025-806-00035)
